title: How far will the UAE national football team advance in the FIFA Arab Cup 2021?
preds: UAE lost in Quarterfinal.  They can't make it to the 3/4th place game or the 1/2nd place game.
As  @SE_Meyer says, finishing second in the group makes it a much tougher route through to the final. Qatar are one of the better teams in this tournament.

10. Dec - 20:00
    Al Bayt Stadium
    Match 26 Qatar (9pts, 6GF 1GA) - United Arab Emirates (6pts, 3GF ,2GA) Losing against Tunisia (6pts, 6GF, 3GA) likely is the end of UAE's journey in the tournament, as it means they finish 2nd in Group B. Oman (4pts, 3GF, 2GA), 2nd of Group A, would have been a much easier choice.
Even if the UAE advance to the semi-finals, it is highly unlikely under those circumstances and team strength indicators that UAE could win against any team such as Morocco, Egypt or Algeria to advance to the finals.

UAE is through the group stage.  UAE now faces Qatar in the quarterfinals.  Qatar has won the last two matches, both played in 2019 after the long term friendly matches turned more contentious after 2017.  Qatar won all three matches in the group stage.  Qatar is ranked 51 and UAE 69 by FIFA, but the points based ranking system has the teams separated by 80 points.  that could be compared to the overall #1 to #19 which has a point difference of 250.

The UAE will likely not beat a Qatar who is hosting the tournament, has a favorable head-to-head record, and has played well recently, including against the United States. Also, for the finals, Morocco, Egypt, and Algeria will be in the running, teams who are better than the whole other half of the bracket.
One match remaining in the group stage.  A win or tie and UAE moves on to the quarterfinals.

Possible opponent of group A in the QF is Qatar, which won't be easy.     3. Dec - 17:00
    Ras Abu Aboud Stadium
    Group B
    Match 11 Mauritania 0 - 1 United Arab Emirates
---     3. Dec - 20:00
    Al Bayt Stadium
    Group B
    Match 12 Syria 2 - 0 Tunisia

Winning first game and next opponent, Mauritania, lost big in its first game.  That suggests Mauritania is struggling and could be beaten by UAE.  Tunisia, who defeated Mauritania, looks to be strong and earns the advantage going in against Syria.  Two wins will definitely push through UAE to the quarterfinals (assuming Tunisia def Syria) regardless of final group match against Tunisia.  Only slight change today.  Need to scan after game two complete.

30. Nov - 11:00
    Ahmad Bin Ali Stadium
    Group B
    Match 2 Tunisia 5 - 1 Mauritania ---     30. Nov - 20:00
    Ras Abu Aboud Stadium
    Group B
    Match 4 United Arab Emirates 2 - 1 Syria

Good result in the opening game last night. From the match report it sounds like a decent performance as well. Iraq only drew against Oman in the other group so a quarter final against Qatar looks the most likely outcome.

In the last six matches (since Sep 21), the team has 1 W, 2 L, and 3 D.  The 2 losses come from teams who are not in the tournament.  With a lot of international play to qualify for the world cup in 2022 going on recently, this record doesn't strike me as particularly good or bad.  A few draws in the group stage should get UAE to the quarterfinals, but it will still take some good luck to get into the semi-finals.  slight reduction in group stage estimate and redistributed to quarters/semis.

Revised based on a closer look at rankings and schedule (1). It's likely UAE will finish second in group B, and as a result play the winner of the comparatively weak group A.  With UAE ranked 73, compared to the highest rank side in group A, Qatar at 58th.  the only side in group A ranked higher than the UAE. 1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_FIFA_Arab_Cup

First match on 30 Nov 2021 could already be decisive and is likely going to be a win. (1)    30. Nov - 20:00 Ras Abu Aboud Stadium
    Group B
    Match 4
United Arab Emirates v Syria (forecast: 2 - 0)
(2)     3. Dec - 17:00 Ras Abu Aboud Stadium
    Group B

Mauritania v United Arab Emirates (forecast: 0 - 3)
(3)     6. Dec - 16:00 Al Thumama Stadium

Tunisia v United Arab Emirates (forecast: 2 - 1)
UAE have had a favourable draw. If they get out of the group they will play either Iraq or Qatar, avoiding the North African teams who will be favourites.

The UAE (FIFA rank 69) has already qualified for the Group Stage. They are in pool B with Tunisia (25), Mauritania (104), and Syria (81).  The top two teams advance.  If ranks are the starting point, UAE has a good chance of moving on to the quarter finals.  Both teams from this pool will take on teams from pool A (Iraq (72), Oman (78), Bahrain (91), Qatar (43)).  So taking on Qatar, who is also the host nation, would be a difficult win compared to much closer match-ups with the three other teams.  I'm running out of time to look at ranks and recent records of the other 8 teams in the tournament.   I would keep an eye on matches coming soon, particularly Iraq (72) (12 Oct, previous math in Jan 21 was a draw 0-0) to see how UAE bounces back from a loss to Iran (22) a few days ago.  Overall, UAE has won or tied 9 of 10 matches this year.  However, most of those matches were against non Arab Cup teams.  That seems to bode well for a team with players that play professionally only within UAE.

Firstly, I looked at the success of the UAE in their group B against Tunisia, Syria and Mauritania and concluded they have a good chance of escaping the group, with the battle of 2nd between the UAE and Syria (Tunisia likely to top the group given recent performances). Given the UAE have won 75% of recent meetings and are on better form, it is likely they will advance to the Quarters. Then at Quarters, they will likely face Iraq who will likely win their group. Iraq has historically been more successful 56% of the time, which is reflected by the most likely outcome being the UAE losing the Quarters. If they win their quarters, the chances of them beating their likely opponent Egypt falls by half statistically to then reach the finals.
UAE appeared in Finals appeared once and has not appeared since.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_FIFA_Arab_Cup There are four teams in UAE's group:
1. Tunisia (rank 25)
2. UAE (rank 69)
3. Syria (rank 81)
4. Mauritania  (rank 104). From this, it seems maybe a little more likely than not that UAE will advance past the group stages as the top 2 teams advance.  There are seven other teams ranked higher than the UAE, so it seems unlikely they would win their first matchup after the group stages and it gets progressively more unlikely.  Probability make it out of the group stages (53%). => 47% chance eliminated in group stage. 
Probability win quarter finals game (20%) => .47* .8 => 38% chance eliminated in quarterfinals
Probability win semi-finals game (10%) => .15 * .9 => 13% chance eliminated in semifinals
2% chance win or lose finals.
